headline: Citing Hostility to France in Africa, Macron Threatens a Pullout
abstract: Facing hostility in five former colonies over a stalled fight against extremists, President Emmanuel Macron has taken a harsh public stance. Few expect him to follow through.
lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal â€” France has called five African presidents to a meeting on Monday to disavow rising anti-French hostility in their countries, work out how to stop the rapid advance of armed Islamist extremists in their region and determine whether France will remain deeply engaged in that fight.
keywords: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
